newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian forex market inactive as Bombay banks shut.
newsitem.headline: Indian forex market inactive as Bombay banks shut.

text.p: India's foreign exchange market was virtually closed on Thursday as banks in Bombay, the major financial centre, were closed for a holiday, dealers said.
Banks are open in other major cities but there were no deals. In Madras, banks were quoting dollars at 35.64/66 rupees but there were no deals, a dealer at Madras bank said.
Dealers in Calcutta said there was no activity or quotes.
"The market is very thin when Bombay is closed," said the Madras dealer. "Only, some people try to cover forward," she said. The dollar had closed at 35.65/66 rupees on Wednesday.
